docs.abstract: After four years of investigation and finger-pointing, a trial about whether Exxon Mobil misled investors about the financial risks of climate change started on Tuesday.
docs.snippet: After four years of investigation and finger-pointing, a trial about whether Exxon Mobil misled investors about the financial risks of climate change started on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: After four years of legal sparring and finger-pointing, oil-industry giant Exxon Mobil went to court on Tuesday to face charges that the company lied to shareholders and to the public about the costs and consequences of climate change.

headline.main: Fossil Fuels on Trial: New York’s Lawsuit Against Exxon Begins
headline.print_headline: A Climate Lawsuit Versus Exxon Mobil Finally Goes to Trial

docs.abstract: Electoral officials appear ready to give its president, David E. Granger, another term and control over the country’s new oil riches. Observers cry foul.
docs.snippet: Electoral officials appear ready to give its president, David E. Granger, another term and control over the country’s new oil riches. Observers cry foul.
docs.lead_paragraph: Guyana’s electoral authorities set the stage for the re-election of the country’s president late Friday, when they declared the country’s ruling party the winner of the capital region, in a widely denounced process that threatens to isolate the small South American nation and new oil producer.

headline.main: Guyana Leader Set to Take New Term After a Vote Denounced as Flawed
headline.print_headline: Western Embassies Dispute Guyana Election Maneuver

docs.abstract: America’s biggest energy company, Exxon Mobil, made a big bet on a risky oil prospect in Guyana, a small South American nation. Now the oil giant is entangled in the fight for the country’s political future.
docs.snippet: America’s biggest energy company, Exxon Mobil, made a big bet on a risky oil prospect in Guyana, a small South American nation. Now the oil giant is entangled in the fight for the country’s political future.
docs.lead_paragraph: GEORGETOWN, Guyana — They are the odd couple of the global oil patch: Guyana is a poor former British sugar colony. Exxon Mobil is America’s largest oil company.

headline.main: A Small Country, an Oil Giant, and Their Shared Fortune
headline.print_headline: Guyana and Exxon: An Odd Couple That Share a Very Large Fortune

byline.original: By Anatoly Kurmanaev and Clifford Krauss

docs.abstract: As a leader of the fight against the Trump administration’s rollbacks leaves the stage, what comes next? And what about the Exxon investigation?
docs.snippet: As a leader of the fight against the Trump administration’s rollbacks leaves the stage, what comes next? And what about the Exxon investigation?
docs.lead_paragraph: Eric T. Schneiderman, the New York attorney general who resigned this week after four women accused him of assault, was one of the most active state-level opponents of the Trump administration’s efforts to roll back environmental regulations. He was also the first attorney general to open an investigation into Exxon Mobil’s climate policies and statements.

headline.main: With Schneiderman Out, Environmental Fight Loses a Prominent Voice
headline.print_headline: A Fierce Anti-Pollution Fighter Is Gone. Will His Successor Carry On the Battle?

docs.abstract: Global oil companies see a promising future in Brazil’s offshore fields, setting the country apart from the rest of the world.
docs.snippet: Global oil companies see a promising future in Brazil’s offshore fields, setting the country apart from the rest of the world.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Oil companies bid for offshore drilling rights in an auction here on Thursday that provided some welcome good news for Brazil’s economy after weeks of political uncertainty and unrest.

headline.main: An Oil Auction Provides Brazil a Needed Boost
headline.print_headline: Oil Auction Gives Brazil Some Rare Good News

docs.abstract: The investigation focused on how the company calculated the potential costs of complying with regulations meant to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
docs.snippet: The investigation focused on how the company calculated the potential costs of complying with regulations meant to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission has ended an investigation into Exxon Mobil’s policy of not writing down the value of its oil reserves to account for the risk that future climate change regulations might pose to the company.

headline.main: Inquiry Ends Into Exxon Mobil’s Accounting Tied to Climate Change
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Ends Investigation Into Exxon’s Accounting

docs.abstract: We knew everything we needed to know, and nothing stood in our way. Nothing, that is, except ourselves. A tragedy in two acts.
docs.snippet: We knew everything we needed to know, and nothing stood in our way. Nothing, that is, except ourselves. A tragedy in two acts.
docs.lead_paragraph: We knew everything we needed to know, and nothing stood in our way. Nothing, that is, except ourselves. A tragedy in two acts.

headline.main: Losing Earth: The Decade We Almost Stopped Climate Change

docs.abstract: Scientists at ExxonMobil are working to transform plant waste into biofuel. What they create could one day be used to power jets, trucks and trains, all while producing fewer emissions.
docs.snippet: Scientists at ExxonMobil are working to transform plant waste into biofuel. What they create could one day be used to power jets, trucks and trains, all while producing fewer emissions.

headline.main: From Farm Waste to Fuel Tank

docs.abstract: A Chevron-led joint venture among several energy companies is spending billions of dollars in Kazakhstan to expand an oil field remarkable for its longevity, promise and risk.
docs.snippet: A Chevron-led joint venture among several energy companies is spending billions of dollars in Kazakhstan to expand an oil field remarkable for its longevity, promise and risk.
docs.lead_paragraph: TENGIZ OIL FIELD, Kazakhstan — In a windswept land of salt flats and wild horses, investors are pouring money into one of the largest and most lucrative oil fields outside the Middle East.

headline.main: A Windswept Plain, a Sea of Oil and a Mountain of Money
headline.print_headline: A Land of Wild Horses And Outrageous Profits

byline.original: By Stanley Reed and Nanna Heitmann

docs.abstract: The move would give Qatar better access to Latin American markets and strengthen its relationship with the Trump administration two years into a dispute with Saudi Arabia.
docs.snippet: The move would give Qatar better access to Latin American markets and strengthen its relationship with the Trump administration two years into a dispute with Saudi Arabia.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Qatar Petroleum and Exxon Mobil said on Tuesday that they are making a big investment in American natural gas exports. The deal is designed in part to strengthen Qatar’s ties with the United States nearly two years after Saudi Arabia and its allies launched a trade embargo against the country.

headline.main: Qatar and Exxon Mobil Plan $10 Billion Gas Investment in Texas
headline.print_headline: Qatar Adds To Its Stake In U.S. Gas
